captions.text: - Hey, I saw you smiling at me over there.

- I'm not flirting, just
reading, just reading.

- Oh, so I think I need to
borrow your car this weekend.
- Oh no, I need it this weekend.

- I know, but Davis
won't let me borrow his,
so I really need your car.
- I might take your car this weekend.
- Didn't mean to put that in there.

- Whoa, did not expect
that to come from you.
Would you do me a big favor?
- Oh my gosh, you are so cute.
You're just so adorable, you know?
- Okay, so it looks like Ashton and Jared
are gonna come to the party too tomorrow.
- No, I don't want Jared there.
- I'm not gonna show if he's there.
- Hey, do you know where the library is?
- Do you know where the parking garage is?
- Do you know where McDonald's is?

- This is inevitable, so
I'm just gonna say it.
I really think we need to break up.
Are you mad about something, what's up?

- You're just like really
cute when you're angry.

- You say that, but I
don't think you mean it.
- Could I just have a hug?
- Oh, you're just the best person to hug.
Yeah, this is not gonna work.

title: 9 Problems Only Ladies With Resting Niceface Understand

comments.text:
I'm a guy, but most of this happens to me too. -_-  Also, random tourists 
always want me to take their picture. (Then again, I'm an amateur 
photographer, so I always wind up getting really into it and posing them 
all over the place, so I guess I shouldn't complain.)﻿
comments.author: Drunken Pirate

comments.text:
See, I like having resting nice face because people will talk to me more 
easily and I love being around people. But whenever I'm brave enough to 
talk about the fact I have MDD (Major Depressive Disorder), they think I'm 
lying or say "Oh, but you're always so happy!" I don't know, I understand 
depression is difficult to see in others but just because someone is 
smiling does not make them happy.
That being said, this video is one of he most accurate things I've ever 
seen and I'm glad Resting Nice Face is an actual thing :)﻿
comments.author: PeaceLoveSarahJane

comments.text: HEY BUZZFEED! You should do the Resting Sad Face !!!! Like now! ﻿

comments.text:
Ah, this.  I always have strangers trying to sit next to me, and always ask 
me for directions.  I also had a heterosexual couple ask me about my cigar 
(I was having an extremely stressful week and I ended up buying a package 
of cheap Captain Black "gas station" cigars, and I ended up in the smoking 
section of a local mall.  The guy asked about it first (saying that "It 
smells wonderful!").  Yes, cigar tobacco smells great.  The girlfriend was 
royally pissed at the guy for talking to me.

And I'm an introvert.  All this extra energy of talking to people makes me 
mad!﻿

comments.text:
I was on the bus a couple of months ago and this family gets on, a dad, a

hands are full of baby. She looks around her eyes meet mine for a sec, and 
she just plops the baby down on my lap. Didn't even say anything. I ended 
up holding the little boy almost until they got off the bus.....lol. RNF is 
a thing people.﻿
